name: Doublefile Viburnum
climate: Doublefile Viburnum prefers temperate climates with moderate seasonal changes.
It thrives in regions where summers are not excessively hot and winters are mild.
The plant can tolerate a range of climates but performs best in moderate temperatures.
Regions with distinct seasons are ideal, as they align with the plant's growth cycle.
sunlight: Prefers full sun to partial shade; too much sun can harm the leaves.
It requires at least six hours of sunlight daily for optimal flowering.
In hotter climates, some afternoon shade is beneficial to prevent wilting.
Partial shade helps protect the plant from excessive heat and sunburn.
watering: Requires consistent moisture but should not be waterlogged to prevent root rot.
During dry spells or high temperatures, increase the watering frequency.
Ensure the soil is well-draining to avoid standing water around the roots.
Water deeply once a week, allowing the soil to dry slightly between waterings.
soil: Thrives in well-drained, loamy soil rich in organic matter for nutrients.
Slightly acidic to neutral pH levels are ideal for vigorous growth.
Avoid heavy clay soils that could retain too much moisture and suffocate roots.
Soil should be enriched with compost or mulch to retain moisture and improve drainage.
extra_care_tip: Prune after flowering to shape the plant and promote denser growth.
Remove dead or damaged branches to maintain plant health and appearance.
